meanings.definition: To surpass in thinking or intelligence.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outthink her opponents in chess.
meanings.sent2: He outthinks his classmates when it comes to solving math problems.
meanings.sent3: The detective outthinks the criminal and solves the case.
meanings.sent4: Her strategic mind allows her to outthink any obstacle in her way.
meanings.sent5: Outthinking the competition is key to winning the game.

meanings.definition: To outsmart or outwit someone by thinking more cleverly.
meanings.sent1: The fox uses its cunning to outthink the hunter.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outthink her opponents in debates.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat outthinks the dog and gets the treat first.
meanings.sent4: He outthinks his rivals with his quick wit and sharp mind.
meanings.sent5: Outthinking your opponent is the key to winning the argument.
